message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with sentiment analysis on financial microblogs and news using natural language processing techniques. It also involves the use of bag-of-words representations and lexical-based features, which are commonly used in computational linguistics. 

It could also belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as the task involves predicting sentiment polarity and intensity from short texts, which is a common problem in information retrieval. 

Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as the paper discusses the use of regression analysis and the creation of financial word embeddings to improve the performance of sentiment analysis. 

Finally, it could be classified under cs.CE (Computational Economics) as the task involves analyzing sentiment towards companies/stocks mentioned in short texts, which is relevant to the field of computational economics.
